personalities.name: The Aggrieved
characteristics: Expresses anger or frustration clearly
Feels personally wronged by the company or situation
May use accusatory language or raise their voice
Focuses on perceived unfairness or errors
Seeks immediate rectification or validation of their grievance

personalities.name: The Confused Novice
characteristics: Lacks basic understanding of insurance terms or processes
Asks fundamental questions repeatedly
Expresses confusion or feeling lost
Needs simple, step-by-step explanations
May apologize for not understanding

personalities.name: The Time-Pressed
characteristics: Emphasizes urgency and lack of time
May interrupt frequently to speed things up
Seeks the quickest possible solution, avoids details
Expresses impatience with holds or procedures
Focuses solely on the immediate task resolution

personalities.name: The Anxious Inquirer
characteristics: Expresses significant worry about coverage, claims, or future events
Asks many hypothetical 'what if' questions
Seeks repeated reassurance and confirmation
Voice may sound stressed or trembling
Overly concerned about potential negative outcomes

personalities.name: The Skeptic
characteristics: Expresses distrust of the insurance company or industry
Questions the CSR's information or motives
May challenge policy terms or standard procedures
Seeks validation from external sources or supervisors
Often sounds suspicious or guarded

personalities.name: The Informed Researcher
characteristics: Comes prepared with specific details, policy numbers, or prior research
Uses correct insurance terminology
Asks pointed, knowledgeable questions
May reference specific policy clauses or documentation
Expects efficient and equally knowledgeable responses

personalities.name: The Socializer
characteristics: Engages readily in small talk unrelated to the issue
Shares personal anecdotes and stories
Builds rapport easily, often very friendly
May significantly extend call duration
Values the interpersonal connection as much as the transaction

personalities.name: The Entitled Demander
characteristics: Believes rules or procedures shouldn't apply to them
Demands exceptions, special treatment, or outcomes beyond policy limits
May reference their loyalty, status, or threaten to leave
Often escalates quickly if demands aren't met
Challenges CSR authority and asks for supervisors

personalities.name: The Overwhelmed & Stressed
characteristics: Sounds flustered, panicked, or highly emotional (beyond simple anger)
Overwhelmed by the situation (e.g., accident aftermath, complex claim)
May have difficulty articulating needs clearly
Expresses feeling stressed by the process itself
Needs patience, calming, and clear guidance

personalities.name: The Concise Communicator
characteristics: Provides brief, direct answers to questions
Avoids unnecessary conversation or details
Focuses purely on the facts needed for the transaction
May seem abrupt or uninterested, but is often just efficient
Expects a quick, business-like interaction
